meanings.definition: A place for the confinement of persons in lawful detention.
meanings.sent1: The small town had two jails for holding people who broke the law.
meanings.sent2: He was taken to the jails after being caught stealing from the store.
meanings.sent3: The jails were so full that they had to put bunk beds in the cells.
meanings.sent4: In the old western movies, the jails always had iron bars on the windows.
meanings.sent5: The jails echoed with the sound of prisoners talking late into the night.

meanings.definition: To put in or as if in jail.
meanings.sent1: The police officer jails the criminal after the court hearing.
meanings.sent2: She jails her keys in a drawer to keep them safe from her little brother.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would jails his friend for eating the last slice of pizza.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to jails the sun, casting a shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The magician jails the rabbit in the hat before pulling it out for the audience.
